concept.title: Snapshots
concept.shortdesc: A snapshot is a set of data captured as it moves through the pipeline. The can save up to ten snapshots of data. You can capture snapshots when you monitor a pipeline.

conbody.p: snapshotsoverviewmonitoringsnapshots of dataView a snapshot to verify how the pipeline processes data. Like data preview, you can view how snapshot data moves through a pipeline stage by stage or across multiple stages. You can drill down to review the values of each record to determine if the stage or group of stages transforms data as expected.

You cannot edit snapshot data when you monitor a pipeline, but when you configure a pipeline, you can use it as source data for data preview. You might capture a snapshot and use it in data preview as part of pipeline testing and development.
